title: Authors and Citation
text: Wei Hong. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hong W (2025). WHKMconf: Kaplan-Meier Confidence Intervals Confidence Bands. R package version 0.8.0, https://github.com/hongconsulting/WHKMconf.
code: @Manual{,   title = {WHKMconf: Kaplan-Meier Confidence Intervals and Confidence Bands},   author = {Wei Hong},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.8.0},   url = {https://github.com/hongconsulting/WHKMconf}, }

what: Kaplan-Meier Confidence Intervals and Confidence Bands
title: Kaplan-Meier Confidence Intervals and Confidence Bands
text: package re-implements selected pointwise confidence intervals simultaneous confidence bands Kaplan–Meier survival estimates km.ci package work Sachs, Brand, Gabriel (2022) improved performance. distinguishing features WHKMconf include: Hollander–McKeague confidence bands include adapt option automatically shortens length band prevent excessive width. Nair confidence bands allow arbitrary confidence levels rather restricted pre-computed tables eαe_{\alpha} critical values. Thomas–Grunkemeier confidence intervals maintain numerical stability extremely small α\alpha values may arise construction Hollander–McKeague confidence bands. ‘WH’ code designed maximize speed, use simulation studies. , input validation minimal user responsible ensuring valid use.

title: Kaplan-Meier Confidence Intervals and Confidence Bands
text: can install development version WHKMconf GitHub :

title: Kaplan-Meier Confidence Intervals and Confidence Bands
code: library(survival) library(WHKMconf) data <- data.frame("time" = survival::ovarian$futime, "status" = survival::ovarian$fustat) fit <- survival::survfit(survival::Surv(time * 12 / 365.2425, status) ~ 1, data = data) s <- summary(fit)  CI <- data.frame("time" = s$time, "surv" = s$surv, "SE" = s$std.err) CI.R <- data.frame(WH_Rothman(s$surv, s$n.risk, s$n.event)) CI <- cbind(CI, setNames(CI.R, c("Rl", "Ru"))) CI.TG <- data.frame(WH_ThomasGrunkemeier(s$time, s$n.risk, s$n.event)) CI <- cbind(CI, setNames(CI.TG, c("TGl", "TGu"))) CI.N <- data.frame(WH_Nair(s$time, s$surv, s$std.err, s$n.risk, s$n.event)) #> [WH_Nair] i = 0:11 of 11, lower = 0.0384615, upper = 0.537895 CI <- cbind(CI, setNames(CI.N, c("Nl", "Nu"))) CI.HM <- data.frame(WH_HollanderMcKeague(s$time, s$n.risk, s$n.event)) #> [WH_HollanderMcKeague] i = 0:11 CI <- cbind(CI, setNames(CI.HM, c("HMl", "HMu")))  t_max <- max(data$time * 12/365.2425) if (max(CI$time) < t_max) {   CI <- rbind(CI, tail(CI, 1))   CI$time[nrow(CI)] <- t_max }  par(cex = 1, las = 1, mar = c(4, 4, 1, 1), xpd = TRUE) plot(x = c(0, CI$time), y = c(1, CI$surv), bty = "l", type = "s", xaxs = "i", yaxs = "i", xaxt = "n", yaxt = "n", xlab = "Time (months)", ylab = "Overall survival", xlim = c(0, t_max), ylim = c(0, 1)) axis(1, at = seq(0, t_max, 6)) axis(2, at = seq(0, 1, 0.25)) lines(y = CI$Rl, x = CI$time, type = "s", lty = 1, col = grDevices::rgb(1, 0, 0)) lines(y = CI$Ru, x = CI$time, type = "s", lty = 1, col = grDevices::rgb(1, 0, 0)) lines(y = CI$TGl, x = CI$time, type = "s", lty = 1, col = grDevices::rgb(1, 0.75, 0)) lines(y = CI$TGu, x = CI$time, type = "s", lty = 1, col = grDevices::rgb(1, 0.75, 0)) lines(y = CI$Nl, x = CI$time, type = "s", lty = 2, col = grDevices::rgb(0, 0.75, 0)) lines(y = CI$Nu, x = CI$time, type = "s", lty = 2, col = grDevices::rgb(0, 0.75, 0)) lines(y = CI$HMl, x = CI$time, type = "s", lty = 2, col = grDevices::rgb(0, 0, 1)) lines(y = CI$HMu, x = CI$time, type = "s", lty = 2, col = grDevices::rgb(0, 0, 1)) legend(legend = c("Rothman", "Thomas\u2013Grunkemeier", "Nair", "Hollander\u2013McKeague"),        col = c(grDevices::rgb(1, 0, 0), grDevices::rgb(1, 0.75, 0),                grDevices::rgb(0, 0.75, 0), grDevices::rgb(0, 0, 1)),        bty = "n", lty = c(1, 1, 2, 2), inset = 0, ncol = 2,        x = 0, y = 0, yjust = 0, xpd = TRUE)

title: Kaplan-Meier Confidence Intervals and Confidence Bands
text: Borokov, .. Sycheva, N.M., 1968. asymptotically optimal non-parametric criteria. Theory Probability & Applications, 13(3), pp. 359–393. Hall, W.J. Wellner, J.., 1980. Confidence bands survival curve censored data. Biometrika, 67(1), pp. 133–143. Hollander, M. McKeague, .W., 1997. Likelihood ratio-based confidence bands survival functions. Journal American Statistical Association, 92(437), pp. 215–226. Klein, J.P. Moeschberger, M.L., 2003. Appendix C: Statistical Tables. Survival Analysis: Techniques Censored Truncated Data, pp. 455–482. New York: Springer New York. Nair, V.N., 1984. Conﬁdence bands survival functions censored data: comparative study. Technometrics, 26, pp. 265–275. Rothman, K.J., 1978. Estimation confidence limits cumulative probability survival life table analysis. Journal Chronic Diseases, 31(8), pp. 557–560. Sachs, M.C., Brand, . Gabriel, E.E., 2022. Confidence bands survival analysis. British Journal Cancer, 127(9), pp. 1636–1641. Thomas, D.R. Grunkemeier, G.L., 1975. Confidence interval estimation survival probabilities censored data. Journal American Statistical Association, 70(352), pp. 865–871.

title: Hollander–McKeague confidence bands — WH_HollanderMcKeague
text: Computes Hollander–McKeague likelihood-ratio simultaneous confidence band¹ Kaplan–Meier survival estimator unique event time.

title: Hollander–McKeague confidence bands — WH_HollanderMcKeague
code: WH_HollanderMcKeague(   time,   risk,   event,   alpha = 0.05,   verbose = TRUE,   adapt = TRUE,   adapt_alpha = 1e-05,   tol_G = 1e-10,   maxit_G = 10000L,   tol_K = 1e-10,   maxit_K = 10000L )

title: Hollander–McKeague confidence bands — WH_HollanderMcKeague
text: time Numeric vector unique event times. risk Integer vector numbers risk time. event Integer vector numbers events time. alpha Optional significance level. Default = 0.05. verbose Optional logical; TRUE, prints additional diagnostic information. Default = TRUE. adapt Optional logical; TRUE, iteratively excludes latest remaining event time time range confidence band desired pointwise αp exceeding adapt_alpha obtained. Default = TRUE. adapt_alpha Optional minimum acceptable value pointwise αp adapt = TRUE. Default = 1e-5. tol_G Optional convergence tolerance infinite series computing Hall–Wellner² distribution function G(, λ). Default = 1e-10. maxit_G Optional maximum number iterations infinite series computing Hall–Wellner distribution function G(, λ). Default = 10000. tol_K Optional convergence tolerance bisection root-finding Hall–Wellner quantile function K(x, ). Default = 1e-10. maxit_K Optional maximum number iterations bisection root-finding Hall–Wellner quantile function K(x, ). Default = 10000.

title: Hollander–McKeague confidence bands — WH_HollanderMcKeague
text: numeric matrix 2 columns: lower limit upper limit.

title: Hollander–McKeague confidence bands — WH_HollanderMcKeague
text: Hollander–McKeague procedure begins specified simultaneous α computes smaller pointwise αp resulting pointwise confidence intervals achieve desired simultaneous coverage. tail survival curve close zero, αp can become small result undesirably wide confidence band. adapt option addresses iteratively excluding latest remaining event time time range confidence band desired αp exceeding adapt_alpha obtained. Extremely small αp can cause 1 − αp round 1 double precision; prevent , αp always rounded half machine epsilon.

title: Hollander–McKeague confidence bands — WH_HollanderMcKeague
text: Hollander, M. McKeague, .W., 1997. Likelihood ratio-based confidence bands survival functions. Journal American Statistical Association, 92(437), pp. 215–226. Hall, W.J. Wellner, J.., 1980. Confidence bands survival curve censored data. Biometrika, 67(1), pp. 133–143.

title: Hollander–McKeague pointwise significance level — WH_HollanderMcKeague_alpha
text: Computes pointwise αp Hollander–McKeague confidence bands.

title: Hollander–McKeague pointwise significance level — WH_HollanderMcKeague_alpha
code: WH_HollanderMcKeague_alpha(   risk,   event,   surv,   SE,   alpha = 0.05,   tol_G = 1e-10,   maxit_G = 10000L,   tol_K = 1e-10,   maxit_K = 10000L )

title: Hollander–McKeague pointwise significance level — WH_HollanderMcKeague_alpha
text: risk Integer vector numbers risk unique event time. event Integer vector numbers events unique event time. surv Numeric vector Kaplan–Meier survival estimates unique event time. SE Numeric vector standard errors surv. alpha Optional significance level. Default = 0.05. tol_G Optional convergence tolerance infinite series computing Hall–Wellner² distribution function G(, λ). Default = 1e-10. maxit_G Optional maximum number iterations infinite series computing Hall–Wellner distribution function G(, λ). Default = 10000. tol_K Optional convergence tolerance bisection root-finding Hall–Wellner quantile function K(x, ). Default = 1e-10. maxit_K Optional maximum number iterations bisection root-finding Hall–Wellner quantile function K(x, ). Default = 10000.

title: Hollander–McKeague pointwise significance level — WH_HollanderMcKeague_alpha
text: pointwise significance level αp.

title: Hollander–McKeague pointwise significance level — WH_HollanderMcKeague_alpha
text: Hollander, M. McKeague, .W., 1997. Likelihood ratio-based confidence bands survival functions. Journal American Statistical Association, 92(437), pp. 215–226. Hall, W.J. Wellner, J.., 1980. Confidence bands survival curve censored data. Biometrika, 67(1), pp. 133–143.

title: Nair confidence bands — WH_Nair
text: Computes Nair's log-transformed equal-precision simultaneous confidence band¹ Kaplan–Meier survival estimator unique event time.

title: Nair confidence bands — WH_Nair
code: WH_Nair(   time,   surv,   SE,   risk,   event,   alpha = 0.05,   verbose = TRUE,   tol = 1e-10,   maxit = 10000L,   adapt = TRUE,   MC_step = 100000L,   MC_rep = 100000L,   MC_seed = 24601L,   e_alpha_override = 0 )

title: Nair confidence bands — WH_Nair
text: time Numeric vector unique event times. surv Numeric vector Kaplan–Meier survival estimates time. SE Numeric vector standard errors surv. risk Integer vector numbers risk time. event Integer vector numbers events time. alpha Optional significance level. Default = 0.05. verbose Optional logical; TRUE, prints additional diagnostic information. Default = TRUE. tol Optional convergence tolerance Borokov–Sycheva approximation. Default = 1e-10. maxit Optional maximum number iterations Borokov–Sycheva approximation. Default = 10000. adapt Optional logical; TRUE, computation eα automatically falls back Monte Carlo method Borokov–Sycheva approximation fails converge. Default = TRUE. MC_step Optional number variance-stabilized Brownian bridge discretization steps Monte Carlo fallback. Default = 1e5. MC_rep Optional number replicates Monte Carlo fallback. Default = 1e5. MC_seed Optional random seed Monte Carlo fallback. Default = 24601. e_alpha_override Optional numeric value overriding critical value eα.

title: Nair confidence bands — WH_Nair
text: numeric matrix 2 columns: lower limit upper limit.

title: Nair confidence bands — WH_Nair
text: equal-precision critical value eα calculated using Borokov–Sycheva approximation² (WH_e_alpha()). method aligns closely Monte Carlo simulations using 100,000 variance-stabilized Brownian bridge discretization steps 100,000 replicates (WH_e_alpha_MC()) compared pre-computed tables published Klein Moeschberger (2003)³.

title: Nair confidence bands — WH_Nair
text: Nair, V.N., 1984. Conﬁdence bands survival functions censored data: comparative study. Technometrics, 26, pp. 265–275. Borokov, .. Sycheva, N.M., 1968. asymptotically optimal non-parametric criteria. Theory Probability & Applications, 13(3), pp. 359–393. Klein, J.P. Moeschberger, M.L., 2003. Appendix C: Statistical Tables. Survival Analysis: Techniques Censored Truncated Data, pp. 455–482. New York: Springer New York.

title: Rothman confidence intervals — WH_Rothman
text: Computes Rothman binomial pointwise confidence intervals¹ Kaplan–Meier survival estimator unique event time.

title: Rothman confidence intervals — WH_Rothman
text: surv Numeric vector Kaplan–Meier survival probabilities. risk Integer vector numbers risk change surv. event Integer vector event counts change surv. alpha Optional significance level. Default = 0.05.

title: Rothman confidence intervals — WH_Rothman

title: Critical value for Nair's equal-precision confidence bands (Borokov–Sycheva) — WH_e_alpha
text: Computes critical value eα Nair's equal-precision confidence bands¹ using Borokov–Sycheva approximation². Note: reproduce Table 2 Nair (1984), use alpha/2.

title: Critical value for Nair's equal-precision confidence bands (Monte Carlo) — WH_e_alpha_MC
text: Computes critical value eα Nair's equal-precision confidence bands¹ using Monte Carlo simulation. Note: reproduce Table 2 Nair (1984), use alpha/2.

title: Critical value for Nair's equal-precision confidence bands (Monte Carlo) — WH_e_alpha_MC
text: lower Lower limit supremum evaluation. upper Upper limit supremum evaluation. alpha Significance level. n_step Optional number discretization steps variance-stabilized Brownian bridge. Default = 1e5. n_rep Optional number Monte Carlo replicates. Default = 1e5. seed Optional random seed. Default = 24601.
